concept.title: Frequency Response
concept.shortdesc: Understanding how systems and spaces respond to different frequencies.

section.title: Defining Frequency Response
section.p: Frequency response describes how a system or space handles different frequencies, typically measured as amplitude variation across the frequency spectrum.

section.title: Measurement and Analysis
section.p: Frequency response is typically measured using:

ul.li: Sine sweeps: Gradually changing single frequencies
Pink noise: Equal energy per octave
Real-time analyzers (RTA): For visual frequency analysis
Transfer function measurements: Comparing input to output

section.title: Common Characteristics
section.p: Key aspects of frequency response include:

ul.li: Bandwidth: The range of frequencies reproduced
Flatness: How evenly frequencies are reproduced
Roll-off: Natural decrease at frequency extremes
Resonances: Peaks in response at specific frequencies
